19#include <vector>
20
21namespace ZXing {
22
23class GenericGF;
24
25/**
26* <p>Implements Reed-Solomon decoding, as the name implies.</p>
27*
28* <p>The algorithm will not be explained here, but the following references were helpful
29* in creating this implementation:</p>
30*
31* <ul>
32* <li>Bruce Maggs.
33* <a href="http://www.cs.cmu.edu/afs/cs.cmu.edu/project/pscico-guyb/realworld/www/rs_decode.ps">
34* "Decoding Reed-Solomon Codes"</a> (see discussion of Forney's Formula)</li>
35* <li>J.I. Hall. <a href="www.mth.msu.edu/~jhall/classes/codenotes/GRS.pdf">
36* "Chapter 5. Generalized Reed-Solomon Codes"</a>
37* (see discussion of Euclidean algorithm)</li>
38* </ul>
39*
40* <p>Much credit is due to William Rucklidge since portions of this code are an indirect
41* port of his C++ Reed-Solomon implementation.</p>
42*
43* @author Sean Owen
44* @author William Rucklidge
45* @author sanfordsquires
46*/
47class ReedSolomonDecoder
48{
49public:
50 /**
51 * <p>Decodes given set of received codewords, which include both data and error-correction
52 * codewords. Really, this means it uses Reed-Solomon to detect and correct errors, in-place,
53 * in the input.</p>
54 *
55 * @param received data and error-correction codewords
56 * @param twoS number of error-correction codewords available
57 * @throws ReedSolomonException if decoding fails for any reason
58 */
59 static bool Decode(const GenericGF& field, std::vector<int>& received, int twoS);
60};
61
62} // ZXing
63
